newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil IGP-DI inflation rises 0.42 pct in February.
newsitem.headline: Brazil IGP-DI inflation rises 0.42 pct in February.

text.p: Brazil's Indice Geral de Precos - Disponibilidade Interna (IGP-DI) rose 0.42 percent in February, against a 1.58 percent advance in January, the independent research institute Getulio Vargas Foundation (FGV) said.

The IGP-DI index is a compilation of three indices -- the IPA wholesale price index, which rose 0.34 percent in the period; the IPC consumer price index, which advanced 0.53 percent; and the INCC national index of construction costs, which gained 0.48 percent.
The FGV releases the IGP-DI figure once a month.
